TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit SoapFieldAttribute extends System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.SoapAttribute

Docs.summary: Customizes SOAP generation and processing for a field. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The target objects for the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.SoapFieldAttribute> attribute are object fields. The <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.SoapFieldAttribute> attribute is used to specify information that controls how the .NET Framework generates the SOAP XML wire format for target fields.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates customization of SOAP generated for a field of a class with the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.SoapFieldAttribute>. The SOAP can be produced by the code shown in the <xref:System.SerializableAttribute> class example.
[!code-cpp[SoapAttributes1#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SoapAttributes1/CPP/s.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[SoapAttributes1#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SoapAttributes1/CS/s.cs#1)] [!code-vb[SoapAttributes1#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SoapAttributes1/VB/s.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Returns a value indicating whether the current attribute contains interop XML element values.
Docs.returns: if the current attribute contains interop XML element values; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the order of the current field attribute.
Docs.value: The order of the current field attribute.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You should not use this property; it is not used by the .NET Framework remoting infrastructure.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the XML element name of the field contained in the attribute.
Docs.value: The XML element name of the field contained in this attribute.
